tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Job continue speaking.

tn.ref: I have made a covenant with my eyes
tn.text: AT: "I have promised myself that I would not look with lust at a woman" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: how then should I look with desire on a virgin?
tn.text: Job uses a question to emphasize that he would never break his promise. AT: "So I certainly will not look with lust at a virgin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: For what is the portion from God above, the inheritance from the Almighty on high?
tn.text: Both of these mean the same thing. Job uses a question to emphasize that God would not give him anything good if he sins and breaks his promise. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Job continues speaking.

tn.ref: Does not God see my ways and count all my steps?
tn.text: Here "my ways" and "my steps" refer to Job's behavior. Job uses a question for emphasis. AT: "Certainly God watches me and knows everything that I do." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Job continues speaking.

tn.ref: If I have
tn.text: In 31:5-40 Job describes different situations in which he would deserve God's punishment. But, he knows that they are not true and he is innocent. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])

tn.ref: walked with falsehood, if my foot has hurried to deceit
tn.text: AT: "done anything false or purposely deceived anyone"

tn.ref: let me be weighed in an even balance
tn.text: People used balances to weigh items and to determine their value. AT: "Let God judge me honestly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Job continues describing situations in which he would deserve God's punishment, but he knows they are not true. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])

tn.ref: If my step has turned out of the right way
tn.text: AT: "If I have stopped doing what is right" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: if my heart has walked after my eyes
tn.text: AT: "if I have done any wicked things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: if any spot of impurity has clung to my hands
tn.text: AT: "if I am guilty of any sin at all"

tn.ref: let the harvest be uprooted out of my field
tn.text: AT: "let someone else come and take the harvest from my field" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Job continues describing situations in which he would deserve God's punishment, but he knows they are not true. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])

tn.ref: If my heart has been attracted to another woman
tn.text: AT: "If I have desired another man's wife" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: if I have lain in wait at my neighbor's door for his wife
tn.text: "and I have waited for him to leave his house so I could sleep with her"

tn.ref: then let my wife grind grain for another man
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) this is a way of saying another man will sleep with Job's wife or 2) it means she will become a slave and work for another man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Job continues describing situations in which he would deserve God's punishment, but he knows they are not true. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])

tn.ref: it would be a crime to be punished by judges
tn.text: AT: "it would be a crime for which judges would be right to punish me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: For that is a fire that consumes everything for Sheol and that would burn up all my harvest
tn.text: Job is emphasizing how terrible and destructive the sin of adultery is. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Job continues describing situations in which he would deserve God's punishment, but he knows they are not true. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])

tn.ref: what then would I do when God rises up to accuse me? When he comes to judge me, how would I answer him?
tn.text: Job uses a question for emphasis. AT: "then there would absolutely nothing I could say to defend myself when God comes to judge me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Did the one who made me in the womb not make them also? Did not the same one mold us all in the womb?
tn.text: AT: "God, who certainly made me in the same way he made them, should judge me with the same sense of justice as he judges them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Job begins describing situations in which he would deserve God's punishment (described in [[:en:bible:notes:job:31:22|31:22]]), but he knows they are not true. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])

tn.ref: I have caused the eyes of the widow to grow dim from crying
tn.text: Here "to grow dim" refers to the widow having bad eyesight due to how much she cries. AT: "I have caused a widow to cry in great sadness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: my morsel
tn.text: "my food"

tn.ref: from my youth the orphan grew up with me as with a father, and I have guided his mother, a widow, from my own mother's womb
tn.text: Job is describing how he truly treated the orphan and widow. AT: "I have taken care of orphans and widows since I was very young"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Job continues describing situations in which he would deserve God's punishment (described in [[:en:bible:notes:job:31:22|31:22]]), but he knows they are not true. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])

tn.ref: if his heart has not blessed me because he has not been warmed with the wool of my sheep,
tn.text: AT: "I have given such people woolen clothing that has kept them warm, and so they have blessed me; but if I had not done that," (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: I have lifted up my hand against
tn.text: AT: "I have threatened to harm" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: in the city gate
tn.text: This is where the important men of the city would gather to make decisions.

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Job continues describing situations in which he would deserve God's punishment, but he knows they are not true. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])

tn.ref: then let my shoulder fall from the shoulder blade, and let my arm be broken from its joint
tn.text: AT: "then let someone tear off my shoulder and break my arm" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Job continues describing situations in which he would deserve God's punishment, but he knows they are not true. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])

tn.ref: if I have said to fine gold, 'You are what I am confident in'
tn.text: This line means the same thing as the previous line. Together they emphasize that Job has not trusted in wealth to bring him security. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: my hand had gotten many possessions
tn.text: AT: "I have gained many possessions by my own ability" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Job continues describing situations in which he would deserve God's punishment, but he knows they are not true. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])

tn.ref: the moon walking
tn.text: AT: "the moon moving across the sky" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: if my heart has been secretly attracted
tn.text: AT: "if I have secretly desired to worship them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: my mouth has kissed my hand
tn.text: This is a sign of love and devotion.

tn.ref: to be punished by judges
tn.text: AT: "for which judges would be right to punish me"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Job continues describing situations in which he would deserve God's punishment, but he knows they are not true. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])

tn.ref: Indeed, I have not even allowed my mouth to sin by asking for his life with a curse
tn.text: Job is describing how he truly treated those who hated him. AT: "Actually, I did not even let myself sin by cursing his life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Job continues describing situations in which he would deserve God's punishment, but he knows they are not true. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])

tn.ref: If the men of my tent have never said, 'Who can find one who has not been filled with Job's food?'
tn.text: AT: "My men have always been able to say, 'Everyone we know of has had as much of Job's food as he wants!' If that were not true," (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: the foreigner has never had to stay in the city square, because I have always opened my doors to the traveler
tn.text: Job is explaining how he truly treated foreigners. AT: "travelers never had to sleep on the street. I always welcomed them into my house"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Job continues describing situations in which he would deserve God's punishment, but he knows they are not true. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])

tn.ref: because I feared the great multitude, because the contempt of families terrified me
tn.text: These mean the same thing. They emphasize that a person may hide his sin because he fears what other people may say. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: here is my signature
tn.text: Job is describing his complaint to God as if he wrote it down in a legal document. He would write his name on it as a promise that everything in the document is true.

tn.ref: If only I had the indictment that my opponent has written!
tn.text: "If only I could read my opponent's complaint against me!"

tn.ref: Surely I would carry it openly on my shoulder; I would put it on like a crown
tn.text: This means if God would write down his complaints against Job, then Job would put the document where everyone could read it.

tn.ref: for my steps
tn.text: This refers to Job's actions.

tn.ref: as a confident prince
tn.text: This means Job would approach God without any fear. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: This concludes Job's description of situations in which he would deserve God's punishment, but he knows they are not true. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])

tn.ref: If my land ever cries out against me, and its furrows weep together
tn.text: Job describes the land as a person who cries because Job has stolen it from its proper owner. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
